fields.name: taxAppConfigure
fields.description: Allows tax app configurations for tax partners.

fields.name: themeCreate
fields.description:
Creates a theme using an external URL or for files that were previously uploaded using the
[stagedUploadsCreate mutation](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/stageduploadscreate).
These themes are added to the [Themes page](https://admin.shopify.com/themes) in Shopify admin.

fields.name: themeDelete

fields.name: translationsRegister

fields.name: translationsRemove

fields.name: urlRedirectBulkDeleteAll
fields.description: Asynchronously delete [URL redirects](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/UrlRedirect) in bulk.

objects in bulk by IDs.
Learn more about [URLRedirect](https://help.shopify.com/en/manual/online-store/menus-and-links/url-redirect) 
objects.

fields.name: urlRedirectBulkDeleteBySavedSearch
fields.description: Asynchronously delete redirects in bulk.

fields.name: urlRedirectBulkDeleteBySearch
fields.description: Asynchronously delete redirects in bulk.

fields.name: urlRedirectCreate
fields.description: Creates a [`UrlRedirect`](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/UrlRedirect) object.

fields.name: urlRedirectDelete
fields.description: Deletes a [`UrlRedirect`](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/UrlRedirect) object.

fields.name: urlRedirectImportCreate
fields.description:
Creates a [`UrlRedirectImport`](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/UrlRedirectImport) object.

After creating the `UrlRedirectImport` object, the `UrlRedirectImport` request can be performed using the [`urlRedirectImportSubmit`](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/urlRedirectImportSubmit) mutation.

fields.name: urlRedirectImportSubmit
fields.description:
Submits a `UrlRedirectImport` request to be processed.

The `UrlRedirectImport` request is first created with the [`urlRedirectImportCreate`](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/urlRedirectImportCreate) mutation.

fields.name: urlRedirectUpdate
fields.description: Updates a URL redirect.

fields.name: validationCreate
fields.description: Creates a validation.

fields.name: validationDelete
fields.description: Deletes a validation.

fields.name: validationUpdate
fields.description: Update a validation.

fields.name: webPixelCreate
fields.description:
Activate a [web pixel extension](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/build/marketing-analytics/build-web-pixels)
by creating a web pixel record on the store where you installed your app.

When you run the `webPixelCreate` mutation, Shopify validates it
against the settings definition in `shopify.extension.toml`. If the `settings` input field doesn't match
the schema that you defined, then the mutation fails. Learn how to
define [web pixel settings](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/build/marketing-analytics/build-web-pixels#step-2-define-your-web-pixel-settings).

fields.name: webPixelDelete
fields.description: Deletes the web pixel shop settings.

fields.name: webPixelUpdate
fields.description:
Activate a [web pixel extension](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/build/marketing-analytics/build-web-pixels)
by updating a web pixel record on the store where you installed your app.

When you run the `webPixelUpdate` mutation, Shopify validates it
against the settings definition in `shopify.extension.toml`. If the `settings` input field doesn't match
the schema that you defined, then the mutation fails. Learn how to
define [web pixel settings](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/build/marketing-analytics/build-web-pixels#step-2-define-your-web-pixel-settings).

fields.name: webhookSubscriptionCreate
fields.description:
Creates a new webhook subscription.

Building an app? If you only use app-specific webhooks, you won't need this. App-specific webhook subscriptions specified in your `shopify.app.toml` may be easier. They are automatically kept up to date by Shopify & require less maintenance. Please read [About managing webhook subscriptions](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/build/webhooks/subscribe).

fields.name: webhookSubscriptionDelete
fields.description:
Deletes a webhook subscription.

Building an app? If you only use app-specific webhooks, you won't need this. App-specific webhook subscriptions specified in your `shopify.app.toml` may be easier. They are automatically kept up to date by Shopify & require less maintenance. Please read [About managing webhook subscriptions](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/build/webhooks/subscribe).

fields.name: webhookSubscriptionUpdate
fields.description:
Updates a webhook subscription.

Building an app? If you only use app-specific webhooks, you won't need this. App-specific webhook subscriptions specified in your `shopify.app.toml` may be easier. They are automatically kept up to date by Shopify & require less maintenance. Please read [About managing webhook subscriptions](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/build/webhooks/subscribe).

fields.name: additionalFees
fields.description: A list of additional fees applied to the order.

fields.name: agreements
fields.description: A list of sales agreements associated with the order.

fields.name: alerts
fields.description: A list of messages that appear on the order page in the Shopify admin.

fields.name: app
fields.description: The application that created the order.

fields.name: billingAddress
fields.description: The billing address of the customer.

fields.name: billingAddressMatchesShippingAddress
fields.description: Whether the billing address matches the shipping address.

fields.name: canMarkAsPaid
fields.description: Whether the order can be manually marked as paid.

fields.name: canNotifyCustomer
fields.description: Whether a customer email exists for the order.

fields.name: cancelReason
fields.description:
The reason provided when the order was canceled.
Returns `null` if the order wasn't canceled.

fields.name: cancellation
fields.description: Cancellation details for the order.

fields.name: cancelledAt
fields.description:
The date and time when the order was canceled.
Returns `null` if the order wasn't canceled.

fields.name: capturable
fields.description: Whether payment for the order can be captured.

fields.name: cartDiscountAmountSet
fields.description: The total order-level discount amount, before returns, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: channelInformation
fields.description: Details about the channel that created the order.

fields.name: clientIp
fields.description: The IP address of the API client that created the order.

fields.name: closed
fields.description: Whether the order is closed.

fields.name: closedAt
fields.description:
The date and time when the order was closed.
Returns `null` if the order isn't closed.

fields.name: confirmationNumber
fields.description:
A randomly generated alpha-numeric identifier for the order that may be shown to the customer
instead of the sequential order name. For example, "XPAV284CT", "R50KELTJP" or "35PKUN0UJ".
This value isn't guaranteed to be unique.

fields.name: confirmed
fields.description: Whether inventory has been reserved for the order.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Date and time when the order was created in Shopify.

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.description: The shop currency when the order was placed.

fields.name: currentCartDiscountAmountSet
fields.description: The current order-level discount amount after all order updates, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: currentShippingPriceSet
fields.description: The current shipping price after applying refunds and discounts. If the parent `order.taxesIncluded` field is true, then this price includes taxes. Otherwise, this field is the pre-tax price.

fields.name: currentSubtotalLineItemsQuantity
fields.description: The sum of the quantities for all line items that contribute to the order's current subtotal price.

fields.name: currentSubtotalPriceSet
fields.description:
The sum of the prices for all line items after discounts and returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
If `taxesIncluded` is `true`, then the subtotal also includes tax.

fields.name: currentTaxLines
fields.description:
A list of all tax lines applied to line items on the order, after returns.
Tax line prices represent the total price for all tax lines with the same `rate` and `title`.

fields.name: currentTotalAdditionalFeesSet
fields.description:
The total amount of additional fees after returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
Returns `null` if there are no additional fees for the order.

fields.name: currentTotalDiscountsSet
fields.description:
The total amount discounted on the order after returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
This includes both order and line level discounts.

fields.name: currentTotalDutiesSet
fields.description:
The total amount of duties after returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
Returns `null` if duties aren't applicable.

fields.name: currentTotalPriceSet
fields.description:
The total price of the order, after returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
This includes taxes and discounts.

fields.name: currentTotalTaxSet
fields.description: The sum of the prices of all tax lines applied to line items on the order, after returns, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: currentTotalWeight
fields.description: The total weight of the order after returns, in grams.

fields.name: customAttributes
fields.description: A list of additional merchant-facing details that have been added to the order. For example, whether an order is a customer's first.

fields.name: customer
fields.description: The customer that placed the order.

fields.name: customerAcceptsMarketing
fields.description: Whether the customer agreed to receive marketing materials.

fields.name: customerJourneySummary
fields.description: The customer's visits and interactions with the online store before placing the order.

fields.name: customerLocale
fields.description: A two-letter or three-letter language code, optionally followed by a region modifier.

fields.name: discountApplications
fields.description: A list of discounts that are applied to the order, not including order edits and refunds.

fields.name: discountCode
fields.description: The discount code used for the order.

fields.name: discountCodes
fields.description: The discount codes used for the order.

fields.name: displayAddress
fields.description:
The primary address of the customer.
Returns `null` if neither the shipping address nor the billing address was provided.

fields.name: displayFinancialStatus
fields.description:
The financial status of the order that can be shown to the merchant.
This field doesn't capture all the details of an order's financial state. It should only be used for display summary purposes.

fields.name: displayFulfillmentStatus
fields.description:
The fulfillment status for the order that can be shown to the merchant.
This field does not capture all the details of an order's fulfillment state. It should only be used for display summary purposes.
For a more granular view of the fulfillment status, refer to the [FulfillmentOrder](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/FulfillmentOrder) object.

fields.name: disputes
fields.description: A list of the disputes associated with the order.

fields.name: dutiesIncluded
fields.description: Whether duties are included in the subtotal price of the order.

fields.name: edited
fields.description: Whether the order has had any edits applied.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The email address associated with the customer.

fields.name: estimatedTaxes
fields.description:
Whether taxes on the order are estimated.
This field returns `false` when taxes on the order are finalized and aren't subject to any changes.

fields.name: events
fields.description: A list of events associated with the order.

fields.name: exchangeV2s
fields.description: A list of ExchangeV2s for the order.

fields.name: fulfillable
fields.description:
Whether there are line items that can be fulfilled.
This field returns `false` when the order has no fulfillable line items.
For a more granular view of the fulfillment status, refer to the [FulfillmentOrder](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/FulfillmentOrder) object.

fields.name: fulfillmentOrders
fields.description:
A list of fulfillment orders for a specific order.

[FulfillmentOrder API access scopes](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/FulfillmentOrder#api-access-scopes)
govern which fulfillments orders are returned.
An API client will only receive a subset of the fulfillment orders which belong to an order
if they don't have the necessary access scopes to view all of the fulfillment orders.
In the case that an API client does not have the access scopes necessary to view
any of the fulfillment orders that belong to an order, an empty array will be returned.

fields.name: fulfillments
fields.description: List of shipments for the order.

fields.name: fulfillmentsCount
fields.description: The count of fulfillments including the cancelled fulfillments.

fields.name: fullyPaid
fields.description: Whether the order has been paid in full.

fields.name: hasTimelineComment
fields.description: Whether the merchant added a timeline comment to the order.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: legacyResourceId
fields.description: The ID of the corresponding resource in the REST Admin API.

fields.name: lineItems
fields.description: A list of the order's line items.

fields.name: localizedFields
fields.description: List of localized fields for the resource.

fields.name: merchantBusinessEntity
fields.description: The merchant's business entity associated with the order.

fields.name: merchantEditable
fields.description: Whether the order can be edited by the merchant. For example, canceled orders can’t be edited.

fields.name: merchantEditableErrors
fields.description: A list of reasons why the order can't be edited. For example, "Canceled orders can't be edited".

fields.name: merchantOfRecordApp
fields.description: The application acting as the Merchant of Record for the order.

fields.name: metafield
fields.description:
A [custom field](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/build/custom-data),
including its `namespace` and `key`, that's associated with a Shopify resource
for the purposes of adding and storing additional information.

fields.name: metafields
fields.description:
A list of [custom fields](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/build/custom-data)
that a merchant associates with a Shopify resource.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The unique identifier for the order that appears on the order page in the Shopify admin and the Order status page. For example, "#1001", "EN1001", or "1001-A". This value isn't unique across multiple stores.

fields.name: netPaymentSet
fields.description: The net payment for the order, based on the total amount received minus the total amount refunded, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: nonFulfillableLineItems
fields.description:
A list of line items that can't be fulfilled.
For example, tips and fully refunded line items can't be fulfilled.
For a more granular view of the fulfillment status, refer to the [FulfillmentOrder](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/FulfillmentOrder) object.

fields.name: note
fields.description: The contents of the note associated with the order.

fields.name: originalTotalAdditionalFeesSet
fields.description:
The total amount of additional fees at the time of order creation, in shop and presentment currencies.
Returns `null` if additional fees aren't applicable.

fields.name: originalTotalDutiesSet
fields.description:
The total amount of duties at the time of order creation, in shop and presentment currencies.
Returns `null` if duties aren't applicable.

fields.name: originalTotalPriceSet
fields.description: The total price of the order at the time of order creation, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: paymentCollectionDetails
fields.description: The payment collection details for the order.

fields.name: paymentGatewayNames
fields.description:
A list of the names of all payment gateways used for the order.
For example, "Shopify Payments" and "Cash on Delivery (COD)".

fields.name: paymentTerms
fields.description: The payment terms associated with the order.

fields.name: phone
fields.description: The phone number associated with the customer.

fields.name: poNumber
fields.description: The PO number associated with the order.

fields.name: presentmentCurrencyCode
fields.description: The payment `CurrencyCode` of the customer for the order.

fields.name: processedAt
fields.description:
The date and time when the order was processed.
This date and time might not match the date and time when the order was created.

fields.name: publication
fields.description: The publication that the order was created from.

fields.name: purchasingEntity
fields.description: The purchasing entity for the order.

fields.name: refundDiscrepancySet
fields.description: The difference between the suggested and actual refund amount of all refunds that have been applied to the order. A positive value indicates a difference in the merchant's favor, and a negative value indicates a difference in the customer's favor.

fields.name: refundable
fields.description: Whether the order can be refunded.

fields.name: refunds
fields.description: A list of refunds that have been applied to the order.

fields.name: registeredSourceUrl
fields.description: The URL of the source that the order originated from, if found in the domain registry.

fields.name: requiresShipping
fields.description: Whether the order has shipping lines or at least one line item on the order that requires shipping.

fields.name: restockable
fields.description: Whether any line item on the order can be restocked.

fields.name: retailLocation
fields.description: The physical location where a retail order is created or completed, except for draft POS orders completed via the “mark as paid” flow in Admin, which return null.

fields.name: returnStatus
fields.description: The order's aggregated return status for display purposes.

fields.name: returns
fields.description: A list of returns for the order.

fields.name: risk
fields.description: The risk characteristics for the order.

fields.name: shippingAddress
fields.description: The mailing address of the customer.

fields.name: shippingLine
fields.description: A summary of all shipping costs on the order.

fields.name: shippingLines
fields.description: A list of the order's shipping lines.

fields.name: shopifyProtect
fields.description: The Shopify Protect details for the order. If Shopify Protect is disabled for the shop, then this will be null.

fields.name: sourceIdentifier
fields.description:
A unique POS or third party order identifier.
For example, "1234-12-1000" or "111-98567-54". The `receipt_number` field is derived from this value for POS orders.

fields.name: sourceName
fields.description: The name of the source associated with the order.

fields.name: staffMember
fields.description: The staff member associated with the order.

fields.name: statusPageUrl
fields.description: The URL where the customer can check the order's current status.

fields.name: subtotalLineItemsQuantity
fields.description: The sum of the quantities for all line items that contribute to the order's subtotal price.

fields.name: subtotalPriceSet
fields.description:
The sum of the prices for all line items after discounts and before returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
If `taxesIncluded` is `true`, then the subtotal also includes tax.

fields.name: suggestedRefund
fields.description: A suggested refund for the order.

fields.name: tags
fields.description:
A comma separated list of tags associated with the order. Updating `tags` overwrites
any existing tags that were previously added to the order. To add new tags without overwriting
existing tags, use the [tagsAdd](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/tagsadd)
mutation.

fields.name: taxExempt
fields.description: Whether taxes are exempt on the order.

fields.name: taxLines
fields.description:
A list of all tax lines applied to line items on the order, before returns.
Tax line prices represent the total price for all tax lines with the same `rate` and `title`.

fields.name: taxesIncluded
fields.description: Whether taxes are included in the subtotal price of the order.

fields.name: test
fields.description:
Whether the order is a test.
Test orders are made using the Shopify Bogus Gateway or a payment provider with test mode enabled.
A test order can't be converted into a real order and vice versa.

fields.name: totalCapturableSet
fields.description:
The authorized amount that's uncaptured or undercaptured, in shop and presentment currencies.
This amount isn't adjusted for returns.

fields.name: totalCashRoundingAdjustment
fields.description: The total rounding adjustment applied to payments or refunds for an Order involving cash payments. Applies to some countries where cash transactions are rounded to the nearest currency denomination.

fields.name: totalDiscountsSet
fields.description:
The total amount discounted on the order before returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
This includes both order and line level discounts.

fields.name: totalOutstandingSet
fields.description:
The total amount not yet transacted for the order, in shop and presentment currencies.
A positive value indicates a difference in the merchant's favor (payment from customer to merchant) and a negative value indicates a difference in the customer's favor (refund from merchant to customer).

fields.name: totalPriceSet
fields.description:
The total price of the order, before returns, in shop and presentment currencies.
This includes taxes and discounts.

fields.name: totalReceivedSet
fields.description: The total amount received from the customer before returns, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalRefundedSet
fields.description: The total amount that was refunded, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalRefundedShippingSet
fields.description: The total amount of shipping that was refunded, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalShippingPriceSet
fields.description: The total shipping amount before discounts and returns, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalTaxSet
fields.description: The total tax amount before returns, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalTipReceivedSet
fields.description: The sum of all tip amounts for the order, in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: totalWeight
fields.description: The total weight of the order before returns, in grams.

fields.name: transactions
fields.description: A list of transactions associated with the order.

fields.name: transactionsCount
fields.description: The number of transactions associated with the order.

fields.name: unpaid
fields.description: Whether no payments have been made for the order.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The date and time when the order was modified last.

fields.name: amountSet
fields.description: The amount of the order adjustment in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: reason
fields.description: An optional reason that explains a discrepancy between calculated and actual refund amounts.

fields.name: taxAmountSet
fields.description: The tax amount of the order adjustment in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: The connection between the node and its parent. Each edge contains a minimum of the edge's cursor and the node.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: A list of nodes that are contained in OrderAdjustmentEdge. You can fetch data about an individual node, or you can follow the edges to fetch data about a collection of related nodes. At each node, you specify the fields that you want to retrieve.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: An object that’s used to retrieve [cursor information](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/pagination-graphql) about the current page.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: The position of each node in an array, used in [pagination](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/pagination-graphql).

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of OrderAdjustmentEdge.

fields.name: app
fields.description: The application that created the agreement.

fields.name: happenedAt
fields.description: The date and time at which the agreement occured.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique ID for the agreement.

fields.name: order
fields.description: The order associated with the agreement.

fields.name: reason
fields.description: The reason the agremeent was created.

fields.name: sales
fields.description: The sales associated with the agreement.

fields.name: user
fields.description: The staff member associated with the agreement.

fields.name: icon
fields.description: The application icon.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The application ID.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the application.

fields.name: job
fields.description: The job that asynchronously cancels the order.

fields.name: orderCancelUserErrors

fields.name: code

fields.name: field

fields.name: message
fields.description: The error message.

fields.name: staffNote
fields.description: Staff provided note for the order cancellation.

fields.name: transaction
fields.description: The created capture transaction.

fields.name: userErrors

fields.name: descriptionHtml
fields.description: The description of the product, with HTML tags. For example, the description might include bold `` and italic `` text.

fields.description:

to make sure that the app is set up correctly.

For example, if a merchant hasn't set up a product correctly in the app,
then the feedback might include a message that says "You need to add a price
to this product".

fields.name: giftCardTemplateSuffix
fields.description: The [theme template](https://shopify.dev/docs/storefronts/themes/architecture/templates) that's used when customers view the gift card in a store.

A unique, human-readable string of the product's title. A handle can contain letters, hyphens (`-`), and numbers, but no spaces.
The handle is used in the online store URL for the product.

fields.description: Whether the product has only a single variant with the default option and value.

fields.name: hasOutOfStockVariants

fields.name: hasVariantsThatRequiresComponents
fields.description:

Learn more about
[store eligibility for bundles](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/build/product-merchandising/bundles#store-eligibility).

for the purposes of adding and storing additional information.

that a merchant associates with a Shopify resource.

fields.description: The [preview URL](https://help.shopify.com/manual/online-store/setting-up#preview-your-store) for the online store.

fields.description:
The product's URL on the online store.
If `null`, then the product isn't published to the online store sales channel.

fields.description:
A list of product options. The limit is defined by the
[shop's resource limits for product options](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/Shop#field-resourcelimits) (`Shop.resourceLimits.maxProductOptions`).

fields.description:
The minimum and maximum prices of a product, expressed in decimal numbers.
For example, if the product is priced between $10.00 and $50.00,
then the price range is $10.00 - $50.00.

fields.name: productType
fields.description:
The [product type](https://help.shopify.com/manual/products/details/product-type)
that merchants define.

fields.name: publishedAt
fields.description: The date and time when the product was published to the online store.

fields.name: publishedInContext
fields.description: Whether the product is published for a customer only in a specified context. For example, a product might be published for a customer only in a specific location.

fields.name: publishedOnCurrentPublication
fields.description:
Whether the resource is published to the app's
[publication](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/Publication).
For example, the resource might be published to the app's online store channel.

fields.name: publishedOnPublication
fields.description:
Whether the resource is published to a specified
[publication](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/Publication).

fields.name: requiresSellingPlan
fields.description:
Whether the product can only be purchased with
a [selling plan](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/build/purchase-options/subscriptions/selling-plans).
Products that are sold on subscription (`requiresSellingPlan: true`) can be updated only for online stores.
If you update a product to be subscription-only (`requiresSellingPlan:false`), then the product is unpublished from all channels, except the online store.

fields.name: resourcePublicationOnCurrentPublication
fields.description:
The resource that's either published or staged to be published to
the [publication](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/Publication).

fields.name: resourcePublications
fields.description:
The list of resources that are published to a
[publication](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/Publication).

fields.name: resourcePublicationsCount
fields.description:
The number of
[publications](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/Publication)
that a resource is published to, without
[feedback errors](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/ResourceFeedback).

fields.name: resourcePublicationsV2
fields.description:

[publication](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/Publication).

[edit the order](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/build/orders-fulfillment/order-management-apps/edit-orders)
associated with the product. For example, a merchant might be restricted from changing product details when they
edit an order.

fields.name: sellingPlanGroups
fields.description:
A list of all [selling plan groups](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/build/purchase-options/subscriptions/selling-plans/build-a-selling-plan)
that are associated with the product either directly, or through the product's variants.

fields.name: sellingPlanGroupsCount
fields.description:
A count of [selling plan groups](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/build/purchase-options/subscriptions/selling-plans/build-a-selling-plan)

fields.description:

fields.description:
A comma-separated list of searchable keywords that are
associated with the product. For example, a merchant might apply the `sports`
and `summer` tags to products that are associated with sportwear for summer.

Updating `tags` overwrites
any existing tags that were previously added to the product. To add new tags without overwriting
existing tags, use the [`tagsAdd`](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/mutations/tagsadd)

fields.description:

For example, if a product is titled "Black Sunglasses", then the handle is `black-sunglasses`.

fields.name: increment
fields.description:
The value that specifies the quantity increment between minimum and maximum of the rule.
Only quantities divisible by this value will be considered valid.

The increment must be lower than or equal to the minimum and the maximum, and both minimum and maximum
must be divisible by this value.

fields.name: isDefault
fields.description: Whether the quantity rule fields match one increment, one minimum and no maximum.

fields.name: maximum
fields.description:
An optional value that defines the highest allowed quantity purchased by the customer.
If defined, maximum must be lower than or equal to the minimum and must be a multiple of the increment.

fields.name: minimum
fields.description:
The value that defines the lowest allowed quantity purchased by the customer.
The minimum must be a multiple of the quantity rule's increment.

fields.name: originType
fields.description: Whether the values of the quantity rule were explicitly set.

fields.name: assignedFulfillmentOrders
fields.description:
The paginated list of fulfillment orders assigned to the shop locations owned by the app.

Assigned fulfillment orders are fulfillment orders that are set to be fulfilled from locations
managed by
[fulfillment services](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/FulfillmentService)
that are registered by the app.
One app (api_client) can host multiple fulfillment services on a shop.
Each fulfillment service manages a dedicated location on a shop.
Assigned fulfillment orders can have associated
[fulfillment requests](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/enums/FulfillmentOrderRequestStatus),
or might currently not be requested to be fulfilled.

The app must have the `read_assigned_fulfillment_orders`
[access scope](https://shopify.dev/docs/api/usage/access-scopes)
to be able to retrieve the fulfillment orders assigned to its locations.

All assigned fulfillment orders (except those with the `CLOSED` status) will be returned by default.
Perform filtering with the `assignmentStatus` argument
to receive only fulfillment orders that have been requested to be fulfilled.

fields.name: scriptTag
fields.description:
Theme app extensions

Your app might not pass App Store review if it uses script tags instead of theme app extensions. All new apps, and apps that integrate with Online Store 2.0 themes, should use theme app extensions, such as app blocks or app embed blocks. Script tags are an alternative you can use with only vintage themes. Learn more.

Script tag deprecation

Script tags will be sunset for the Order status page on August 28, 2025. Upgrade to Checkout Extensibility before this date. Shopify Scripts will continue to work alongside Checkout Extensibility until August 28, 2025.

Lookup a script tag resource by ID.

fields.name: scriptTags
fields.description:
Theme app extensions

Your app might not pass App Store review if it uses script tags instead of theme app extensions. All new apps, and apps that integrate with Online Store 2.0 themes, should use theme app extensions, such as app blocks or app embed blocks. Script tags are an alternative you can use with only vintage themes. Learn more.

Script tag deprecation

Script tags will be sunset for the Order status page on August 28, 2025. Upgrade to Checkout Extensibility before this date. Shopify Scripts will continue to work alongside Checkout Extensibility until August 28, 2025.

A list of script tags.

Building an app? If you only use app-specific webhooks, you won't need this. App-specific webhook subscriptions specified in your `shopify.app.toml` may be easier. They are automatically kept up to date by Shopify & require less maintenance. Please read [About managing webhook subscriptions](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/build/webhooks/subscribe).

Building an app? If you only use app-specific webhooks, you won't need this. App-specific webhook subscriptions specified in your `shopify.app.toml` may be easier. They are automatically kept up to date by Shopify & require less maintenance. Please read [About managing webhook subscriptions](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/build/webhooks/subscribe).

fields.name: webhookSubscriptionsCount

The count of webhook subscriptions.

Building an app? If you only use app-specific webhooks, you won't need this. App-specific webhook subscriptions specified in your `shopify.app.toml` may be easier. They are automatically kept up to date by Shopify & require less maintenance. Please read [About managing webhook subscriptions](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/build/webhooks/subscribe). Limited to a maximum of 10000.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
A customer-facing description of the selling plan.

If your store supports multiple currencies, then don't include country-specific pricing content, such as "Buy monthly, get 10$ CAD off". This field won't be converted to reflect different currencies.

fields.name: options
fields.description: The values of all options available on the selling plan. Selling plans are grouped together in Liquid when they're created by the same app, and have the same `selling_plan_group.name` and `selling_plan_group.options` values.

fields.name: position
fields.description: Relative position of the selling plan for display. A lower position will be displayed before a higher position.

fields.name: pricingPolicies
fields.description: Selling plan pricing details.

fields.name: translations
fields.description: The published translations associated with the resource.

fields.name: cutoffDay
fields.description:
The cutoff day for the anchor. Specifies a buffer period before the anchor date for orders to be included in a
delivery or fulfillment cycle.

If `type` is WEEKDAY, then the value must be between 1-7. Shopify interprets
the days of the week according to ISO 8601, where 1 is Monday.

If `type` is MONTHDAY, then the value must be between 1-31.

If `type` is YEARDAY, then the value must be `null`.

fields.name: day
fields.description:
The day of the anchor.

If `type` is WEEKDAY, then the value must be between 1-7. Shopify interprets
the days of the week according to ISO 8601, where 1 is Monday.

If `type` isn't WEEKDAY, then the value must be between 1-31.

fields.name: month
fields.description:
The month of the anchor. If type is different than YEARDAY, then the value must
be `null` or between 1-12.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Represents the anchor type, it can be one one of WEEKDAY, MONTHDAY, YEARDAY.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The charge type for the checkout charge.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The charge value for the checkout charge.

fields.name: percentage
fields.description: The percentage value of the price used for checkout charge.

fields.name: interval

fields.name: monthlyAnchor
fields.description:
The day of the month funds will be paid out.

The value can be any day of the month from the 1st to the 31st.
If the payment interval is set to monthly, this value will be used.
Payouts scheduled between 29-31st of the month are sent on the last day of shorter months.

fields.name: weeklyAnchor
fields.description:
The day of the week funds will be paid out.

The value can be any weekday from Monday to Friday.
If the payment interval is set to weekly, this value will be used.

fields.name: categories
fields.description:
Returns the categories of the product taxonomy based on the arguments provided.
If a `search` argument is provided, then all categories that match the search query globally are returned.
If a `children_of` argument is provided, then all children of the specified category are returned.
If a `siblings_of` argument is provided, then all siblings of the specified category are returned.
If a `decendents_of` argument is provided, then all descendents of the specified category are returned.
If no arguments are provided, then all the top-level categories of the taxonomy are returned.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: ancestorIds
fields.description: The IDs of the category's ancestor categories.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: The attributes of the taxonomy category.

fields.name: childrenIds
fields.description: The IDs of the category's child categories.

fields.name: fullName
fields.description: The full name of the taxonomy category. For example, Animals & Pet Supplies > Pet Supplies > Dog Supplies > Dog Beds.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally-unique ID of the TaxonomyCategory.

fields.name: isArchived
fields.description: Whether the category is archived. The default value is `false`.

fields.name: isLeaf
fields.description: Whether the category is a leaf category. A leaf category doesn't have any subcategories beneath it. For example, in Animals & Pet Supplies > Pet Supplies > Dog Supplies > Dog Treadmills, Dog Treadmills is a leaf category. The value is `true` when there are no `childrenIds` specified.

fields.name: isRoot
fields.description: Whether the category is a root category. A root category is at the top level of the category hierarchy and doesn't have a parent category. For example, Animals & Pet Supplies. The value is `true` when there's no `parentId` specified.

fields.name: level
fields.description: The level of the category in the taxonomy tree. Levels indicate the depth of the category from the root. For example, in Animals & Pet Supplies > Pet Supplies > Dog Supplies, Animals & Pet Supplies is at level 1, Animals & Pet Supplies > Pet Supplies is at level 2, and Animals & Pet Supplies > Pet Supplies > Dog Supplies is at level 3.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the taxonomy category. For example, Dog Beds.

fields.name: parentId
fields.description: The ID of the category's parent category.

fields.description: The connection between the node and its parent. Each edge contains a minimum of the edge's cursor and the node.
